sect1.title: testset
sect1.para: The testset application allows the user to emulate a DNP3 master or outstation with custom properties set via an XML configuration file.

sect2.title: Usage
sect2.screen: $ ./testset --help Allowed options: -F [ --configfile ] arg The xml configuration file to use -H [ --help ] display program options -G [ --generate ] Generate a new default config file and exit -E [ --gen_on_no_exist ] Generate the specified config file automatically if it doesn't exist -S [ --slave ] Use slave test set -A [ --scan_start ] arg Start address for a link layer address scan -B [ --scan_stop ] arg Stop address for a link layer address scan

sect2.title: Configuration Files
sect2.para: Testset generates sample XML configuration files for both a DNP3 master and outstation.
Optionally, you can use the --configfile parameter to set the name of the generated file.

sect3.title: Master Schema
sect3.para: A DNP3 master is defined by the MasterTestSet object. The following schema is generated by the testset application:
sect3.programlisting: <MasterTestSet PhysicalLayer="tcpclient" LogFile="master_testset.log"> <Log Filter="LOG_WARNING" /> <Master> <Stack> <LinkLayer IsMaster="true" LocalAddress="100" RemoteAddress="1" UseConfirmations="false" AckTimeoutMS="1000" NumRetries="3" /> <AppLayer TimeoutMS="10000" MaxFragSize="2048" NumRetries="3" /> </Stack> <MasterSettings AllowTimeSync="true" TaskRetryMS="5000" IntegrityPeriodMS="60000" /> <ScanList> <ExceptionScan Class1="true" Class2="true" Class3="true" PeriodMS="2000" /> </ScanList> <Unsol DoTask="false" Enable="false" Class1="true" Class2="true" Class3="true" /> <VtoPorts> <VtoPort PhysicalLayer="vtotunnel" Index="0" StartLocal="true" OpenRetry="5000" /> </VtoPorts> </Master> <PhysicalLayerList> <TCPServer Name="vtotunnel" OpenRetryMS="5000" Endpoint="0.0.0.0" Port="20001" /> <TCPClient Name="tcpclient" OpenRetryMS="5000" Address="127.0.0.1" Port="20000" /> <Serial Name="serial" OpenRetryMS="5000" Device="COM1" BaudRate="9600" Parity="PARITY_NONE" DBits="DATABITS_8" StopBits="STOPBITS_1" FlowControl="FLOW_NONE" /> </PhysicalLayerList> </MasterTestSet>

glossdef.para: LogFile defines the file used to store testset log messages.
PhysicalLayer defines the transport instance listed in the PhysicalLayerList section.
Filter defines the verbosity level that testset should use at startup. Set to one of LOG_DEBUG, LOG_COMM, LOG_INTERPRET, LOG_INFO, LOG_WARNING, LOG_ERROR, or LOG_EVENT.
IsMaster tells the DNP3 link layer whether it is operating as a master or an outstation. This must be set to true if used in a MasterTestSet container.
LocalAddress defines the DNP3 address of the master instance that we are creating. Valid range is 0 to 65535 (inclusive.)
RemoteAddress defines the DNP3 address of the outstation instance to which we will be connecting. Valid range is 0 to 65535 (inclusive.)
UseConfirmations enables/disables DNP3 link layer acknowledgements, which provides for reliable delivery at the expense of throughput. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
AckTimeoutMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait for a DNP3 link layer acknowledgement. Only used if UseConfirmations is set to true.
NumRetries defines the maximum number of DNP3 link layer retransmision attempts when an acknowledgement has not been received before the timer expires. Only used if UseConfirmations is set to true.
TimeoutMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait for a DNP3 application layer acknowledgement.
MaxFragSize defines the maximum DNP3 application layer fragment size used by the stack, in bytes.
NumRetries defines the maximum number of DNP3 application layer retransmision attempts when an acknowledgement has not been received before the timer expires.
AllowTimeSync enables/disables DNP3 time sync with the outstation. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
TaskRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds between retrying the time sync task. Only used if AllowTimeSync is set to true.
IntegrityPeriodMS defines the number of milliseconds between integrity scans of the DNP3 outstation. An integrity scan polls all static and event data from the outstation.
ClassX (where X is 1, 2 or 3) enables/disables DNP3 event reporting for the specified event class.
PeriodMS defines the number of milliseconds between reporting the exceptions.
DoTask enables/disables unsolicited reporting on the DNP3 outstation. This parameter is unused in a DNP3 master configuration.
Enable enables/disables unsolicited reporting by the DNP3 outstation. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
ClassX (where X is 1, 2 or 3) enables/disables unsolicited reporting for the specified event class.
PhysicalLayer defines the transport instance listed in the PhysicalLayerList section. The VTO data will be routed to/from this instance.
Index defines the virtual terminal index to be used for this instance. Valid range is 0 to 255 (inclusive.)

StartLocal enables/disables the VTO PhysicalLayer prior to the DNP3 connection between the master and outstation being established. If disabled, the VTO PhysicalLayer will only start once the DNP3 connection is established. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
OpenRetry defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.

Device defines the system identifier of the serial port to use. On Windows systems, use the standard COMx nomenclature. On Linux-based systems, use the fully qualified path to the device (e.g. /dev/ttyS0).
BaudRate defines the baud rate to use for communication over the serial port. Valid baud rates are 1200, 1800, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, and 230400.
Parity defines the use of the parity bit. Set to one of PARITY_NONE, PARITY_EVEN, or PARITY_ODD.
DBits defines the number of data bits to use for communication over the serial port. Set to one of DATABITS_7 or DATABITS_8.
StopBits defines the number of stop bits to use for communication over the serial port. Set to one of STOPBITS_0, STOPBITS_1, or STOPBITS_2.
FlowControl defines the use of flow control on the serial port. Set to one of FLOW_NONE, FLOW_HARDWARE, or FLOW_XONXOFF.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.
Address defines the network address of the remote system to which the TCP client socket should connect. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and resolvable DNS names are valid.
Port defines the TCP server port of the remote system to which the TCP client socket should connect.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.

Endpoint defines the local network interface to which the TCP server socket should bind. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and resolvable DNS names are valid. The special addresses 0.0.0.0 and :: tells the socket to bind to all interfaces on the system.
Port defines the TCP server port to which the TCP server socket should bind. The port is opened with the SO_REUSEADDR flag enabled.

sect3.title: Outstation Schema
sect3.para: A DNP3 outstation is defined by the SlaveTestSet object. The following schema is generated by the testset application:
sect3.programlisting: <SlaveTestSet LogFile="slave_testset.log" PhysicalLayer="tcpserver" Remote="false" RemotePort="4999" LinkCommandStatus="false" StartOnline="false"> <Log Filter="LOG_WARNING" /> <Slave> <Stack> <LinkLayer IsMaster="false" LocalAddress="1" RemoteAddress="100" UseConfirmations="false" AckTimeoutMS="1000" NumRetries="3" /> <AppLayer TimeoutMS="10000" MaxFragSize="2048" NumRetries="3" /> </Stack> <SlaveConfig MaxBinaryEvents="100" MaxAnalogEvents="100" MaxCounterEvents="100"> <StaticRsp> <BinaryGrpVar Grp="1" Var="2" /> <AnalogGrpVar Grp="30" Var="1" /> <CounterGrpVar Grp="20" Var="1" /> <SetpointStatusGrpVar Grp="40" Var="1" /> </StaticRsp> <EventRsp> <BinaryGrpVar Grp="2" Var="1" /> <AnalogGrpVar Grp="32" Var="1" /> <CounterGrpVar Grp="22" Var="1" /> </EventRsp> <TimeIINTask DoTask="false" PeriodMS="30000" /> <UnsolDefaults DoClass1="false" DoClass2="false" DoClass3="false" PackDelayMS="200" RetryMS="2000" /> </SlaveConfig> <VtoPorts> <VtoPort PhysicalLayer="vtotunnel" Index="0" StartLocal="false" OpenRetry="5000" /> </VtoPorts> </Slave> <DeviceTemplate TemplateName="default"> <BinaryData> <Binary Index="0" Name="binary00" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="1" Name="binary01" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="2" Name="binary02" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="3" Name="binary03" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="4" Name="binary04" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="5" Name="binary05" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="6" Name="binary06" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="7" Name="binary07" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="8" Name="binary08" ClassGroup="1" /> <Binary Index="9" Name="binary09" ClassGroup="1" /> </BinaryData> <AnalogData> <Analog Index="0" Name="analog00" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="1" Name="analog01" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="2" Name="analog02" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="3" Name="analog03" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="4" Name="analog04" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="5" Name="analog05" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="6" Name="analog06" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="7" Name="analog07" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="8" Name="analog08" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> <Analog Index="9" Name="analog09" ClassGroup="1" Deadband="0" /> </AnalogData> <CounterData> <Counter Index="0" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter00" /> <Counter Index="1" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter01" /> <Counter Index="2" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter02" /> <Counter Index="3" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter03" /> <Counter Index="4" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter04" /> <Counter Index="5" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter05" /> <Counter Index="6" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter06" /> <Counter Index="7" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter07" /> <Counter Index="8" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter08" /> <Counter Index="9" ClassGroup="1" Name="counter09" /> </CounterData> <SetpointStatusData> <SetpointStatus Index="0" Name="setpointstatus00" /> <SetpointStatus Index="1" Name="setpointstatus01" /> </SetpointStatusData> <ControlStatusData> <ControlStatus Index="0" Name="controlstatus00" /> <ControlStatus Index="1" Name="controlstatus01" /> </ControlStatusData> <SetpointData> <Setpoint Index="0" Name="setpoint00" ControlMode="SBO" SelectTimeoutMS="5000" /> <Setpoint Index="1" Name="setpoint01" ControlMode="SBO" SelectTimeoutMS="5000" /> </SetpointData> <ControlData> <Control Index="0" Name="control00" ControlMode="SBO" SelectTimeoutMS="5000" /> <Control Index="1" Name="control01" ControlMode="SBO" SelectTimeoutMS="5000" /> </ControlData> </DeviceTemplate> <PhysicalLayerList> <TCPServer Name="tcpserver" OpenRetryMS="5000" Endpoint="0.0.0.0" Port="20000" /> <TCPClient Name="vtotunnel" OpenRetryMS="5000" Address="127.0.0.1" Port="22" /> <Serial Name="serial" OpenRetryMS="5000" Device="COM1" BaudRate="9600" Parity="PARITY_NONE" DBits="DATABITS_8" StopBits="STOPBITS_1" FlowControl="FLOW_NONE" /> </PhysicalLayerList> </SlaveTestSet>

glossdef.para: LogFile defines the file used to store testset log messages.
PhysicalLayer defines the transport instance listed in the PhysicalLayerList section.
Filter defines the verbosity level that testset should use at startup. Set to one of LOG_DEBUG, LOG_COMM, LOG_INTERPRET, LOG_INFO, LOG_WARNING, LOG_ERROR, or LOG_EVENT.
IsSlave tells the DNP3 link layer whether it is operating as a master or an outstation. This must be set to true if used in a SlaveTestSet container.
LocalAddress defines the DNP3 address of the master instance that we are creating. Valid range is 0 to 65535 (inclusive.)
RemoteAddress defines the DNP3 address of the outstation instance to which we will be connecting. Valid range is 0 to 65535 (inclusive.)
UseConfirmations enables/disables DNP3 link layer acknowledgements, which provides for reliable delivery at the expense of throughput. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
AckTimeoutMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait for a DNP3 link layer acknowledgement. Only used if UseConfirmations is set to true.
NumRetries defines the maximum number of DNP3 link layer retransmision attempts when an acknowledgement has not been received before the timer expires. Only used if UseConfirmations is set to true.
TimeoutMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait for a DNP3 application layer acknowledgement.
MaxFragSize defines the maximum DNP3 application layer fragment size used by the stack, in bytes.
NumRetries defines the maximum number of DNP3 application layer retransmision attempts when an acknowledgement has not been received before the timer expires.
AllowTimeSync enables/disables DNP3 time sync with the outstation. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
TaskRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds between retrying the time sync task. Only used if AllowTimeSync is set to true.
IntegrityPeriodMS defines the number of milliseconds between integrity scans of the DNP3 outstation. An integrity scan polls all static and event data from the outstation.
ClassX (where X is 1, 2 or 3) enables/disables DNP3 event reporting for the specified event class.
PeriodMS defines the number of milliseconds between reporting the exceptions.
DoTask enables/disables unsolicited reporting on the DNP3 outstation. This parameter is unused in a DNP3 master configuration.
Enable enables/disables unsolicited reporting by the DNP3 outstation. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
ClassX (where X is 1, 2 or 3) enables/disables unsolicited reporting for the specified event class.
PhysicalLayer defines the transport instance listed in the PhysicalLayerList section. The VTO data will be routed to/from this instance.
Index defines the virtual terminal index to be used for this instance. Valid range is 0 to 255 (inclusive.)

StartLocal enables/disables the VTO PhysicalLayer prior to the DNP3 connection between the master and outstation being established. If disabled, the VTO PhysicalLayer will only start once the DNP3 connection is established. Set to true to enable or false to disable.
OpenRetry defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.

Device defines the system identifier of the serial port to use. On Windows systems, use the standard COMx nomenclature. On Linux-based systems, use the fully qualified path to the device (e.g. /dev/ttyS0).
BaudRate defines the baud rate to use for communication over the serial port. Valid baud rates are 1200, 1800, 2400, 4800, 9600, 19200, 38400, 57600, 115200, and 230400.
Parity defines the use of the parity bit. Set to one of PARITY_NONE, PARITY_EVEN, or PARITY_ODD.
DBits defines the number of data bits to use for communication over the serial port. Set to one of DATABITS_7 or DATABITS_8.
StopBits defines the number of stop bits to use for communication over the serial port. Set to one of STOPBITS_0, STOPBITS_1, or STOPBITS_2.
FlowControl defines the use of flow control on the serial port. Set to one of FLOW_NONE, FLOW_HARDWARE, or FLOW_XONXOFF.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.
Address defines the network address of the remote system to which the TCP client socket should connect. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and resolvable DNS names are valid.
Port defines the TCP server port of the remote system to which the TCP client socket should connect.
Name defines the unique identifier of the transport instance that is used as a reference in the other sections.
OpenRetryMS defines the number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to open the PhysicalLayer.

Endpoint defines the local network interface to which the TCP server socket should bind. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and resolvable DNS names are valid. The special addresses 0.0.0.0 and :: tells the socket to bind to all interfaces on the system.
Port defines the TCP server port to which the TCP server socket should bind. The port is opened with the SO_REUSEADDR flag enabled.
